title: Oil prices hit 11-month highs on tighter supplies, Fed assurance on low rates
text: Oil prices rose for a fourth straight session on Thursday to the highest levels in more than 11 months, underpinned by monetary easing policies and lower crude production in the United States.

title: Market Recap: Wednesday, February 23: Stocks close at session highs

title: Stock Market Update: The Importance of the 50-Day Moving Average

title: S&P 500 to gain 6% in rest of 2021: Reuters poll

title: Wall Street keeps running higher to the close, Dow reaches record finish

title: Dow closes at record high as Powell signals Fed to remain accommodative
text: The Dow closed at record highs on Wednesday after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell wrapped up his second day of testimony to Congress. Powell reiterated his view that the US economy still has a long way to go before hitting the Fed's unemployment rate and inflation targets, signalling that the Fed is likely to continue remaining accommodative with its near-zero Federal Funds Rate and monthly bond purchases.

title: Investing legend Charlie Munger blasts SPACs as indication of an 'irritating bubble' and says the 'world would be better off' without them
text: Berkshire Hathaway vice-chairman Charlie Munger blasted SPACs at the Daily Journal annual meeting on Wednesday, saying that the "world would be better off" without the investment vehicles.  "Crazy speculation in enterprises not even found or picked out yet is a sign of an irritating bubble," Munger said. "The investment banking profession will sell sh-t as long as sh-t can be sold."
